_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: All Other Basic Organic Chemical Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary
1. Facility Policy: The owners, management and employees of Cobitco, Inc. are committed to the prevention of any and all accidental releases of propane. If an accidental release should occur the facility is prepared to work with the Monarch Fire Protection District, St. Louis County LEPC and other authorities to mitigate and minimize the impact of the release to the public and the environment.
2. Facility Information: Midco Products Company, Inc., the previous facility owner, was purcahsed by Cobitco, Inc. effective October 1, 2003. The primary activity at the facility is manufacturing, packaging, and distributing of consumer products. Propane is the main hazardous material used at the facility.
3. Accidental Release Prevention Program: This facility follows the provision of OSHA, 29 CFR 1910.110 and Missouri regulations covering propane.
4. Five-Year Accident History: There have been no accidental releases of propane during the last five years that have caused any injuries, deaths or property damage at the facility, nor have there been any accidental releases resulting in off-site deaths, evacuations, property or environmental damage.
5. Emergency Response Program: The facility has an Emergency Contingency Plan. We do not plan to have our employees respond to a major release. Should a major release of propane occur, the response action is to evacuate the area of the release and call 911 and all applicable emergency response numbers listed in our Emergency Plan.
6. Planned Changes To Improve Safety: Safety improvement is an ongoing process at our facility. Periodic inspections are performed to assess the conditions of the facility. There are no specific safety recommentations regarding the use or storage of propane fore implementation at this time
